channel.title: Premarital Sex
channel.description:
Okay, we went to the High School today, for information about next year. Anyways, this guy came up. He started talking about "abstinence" and "purity" in the religious context. He said it was best we wait until we find "the right one" and marry them. Then he asked if anyone wanted any Purity Cards / Bracelets. Now, I agree with him on most things, like finding the right woman. I also believe that it's wrong to go whoring yourself out in High School. What I don't agree is him using religion to tell us not to have sex.
So what do you think? Right or wrong?

item.title: Premarital Sex
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:89, topic:278300”][quote author=yakman link=topic=367295.msg2857414#msg2857414 date=1246969041]
Why do the three abrahamic religions care about what people consent to do in private?
[/quote]

Why do all the governments in the world care about what people do in private? If I want to torture and murder people in private I should be allowed to do so. Same argument, right?[/quote]

no, wrong.
nobody gives consent to be tortured and murdered.

by the way, the word “consent” means “to give permission”.
that means one person said something like “do you want have sex with me?” and the other person said “yes”.

sex must be with consent, otherwise it is called rape and is morally wrong. (except in some particular circumstances in which I wont go into here)

Moparisthebest:

Also, I don’t see how mutilations like female circumcisions come into this debate, since no one who is humane and sane would do anything like that.

I’ve asserted that religions in general and abrahamic religions in particular seek to ruin peoples sex lives so as to better control them.
you cant just assert things without evidence, so part of the evidence I presented was that female circumcisions stuff.

It is relevant because this drive towards abstinence before marriage is motivated by the same reasons.

Moparisthebest:

Abstinence before marriage should be your choice and not forced upon anyone.

Over the last decade, abstinence-only sex education became more common in the U.S., largely as a result of federal government funding initiatives. Through direct funding and matching grant incentives, the U.S. government steered more than a billion dollars to abstinence-only education programs between 1996 and 2006.[4]

thats a quote from wikipedia, and the citation [4] is http://www.nomoremoney.org/index.cfm?fuseaction=page.viewPage&pageID=947&nodeID=5

that nomoremoney.org site is quite intresting, when I get bored with linking abstinence with religion, I may end up quoting from that website.

I’m also going to post the details of an Alambama law which requires abstinence-only sex education to be taught in schools
http://www.physiciansforlife.org/content/view/128/27/

now Moparisthebest your quote is a bit ambiguous, there are two things you could be saying

  1. I dont believe that abstinence before marriage should be forced upon anybody. (stating your opinion here)
  2. abstinence before marriage is not forced upon anybody. (stating a fact here)

I dont know which you meant.
In the first case, you should be outraged at the material I’ve just posted and you should should contact your Local Representative.
In the second case, thats not true, it is being forced.

also, that information may be slightly out of date as the Bush Administration is finished, but it is still relevant because I havent been able to find anything about those laws being repealed.

Read full topic

Give me an example.

Gay marriage

How is that a generalization? It seems to be very specific meaning the marriage of two people of the same sex.
[/quote]

Catholics are against it because they think gay people don’t love each other. They seem to marry each other for the sex. But who are you to decide who marries and who doesn’t?[/quote]

Again, that isn’t a generalization. Anyway, the whole issue of homosexuality is another issue that is debated in another thread. It doesn’t have anything to do with premarital sex.

item.title: Premarital Sex
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Why do the three abrahamic religions care about what people consent to do in private?

Sexual abstiance is another example of their desire to control us. They want to make it that sex involves little pleasure and a lot of pain.
You see how there exists that foul practise of circumcision. For women, it involves cutting off the labia and clitoris, then sewing up the vaginal opening with the condition that the stitches are only to be removed painfully on the girls wedding night. The practise is an obvious attempt to ruin the sex life of a woman, and to reduce her to mere property.
Male circumcision is a little better, although we enjoy the privalage of being the “right” sex according to abrahamic religions. It involves removing the foreskin, which by the way, contains many nerve endings. Male circumcision has also been used to try to stop mastrubation. It is obviously a way in which they try to control you and ruin your sex life.

These practices are normally done on newborn babies, too young to know what happening and too young to give consent.

So I tell you this, by all means cut off your own clitoris, or the tip of your own penis, but leave these children alone. Leave us alone and we’ll leave you alone. Stop trying to implement your bronze age rules on sex before marriage on the unfortunate American people.

However, I know its unlikely that you’ll stop doing it because your religion depends on spreading itself to the most vulnerable people in our society.
In the same way that a rabies makes its unfortunate dog run around finding new people to inject, the mind-virus we call faith goes around try to find new converts.

Read full topic

item.title: Premarital Sex
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“grantbm, post:77, topic:278300”]Sexual abstinence is harmless, but a study by the British Medical Journal in 1997 over a 10 year period showed that having sex improved sense of smell, reduced risk of heart disease, improved weight loss, improved overall fitness, reduced depression, pain-relief, Less-frequent contraction of colds and flu, better bladder control, and better teeth. Within having sex there are many benefits, but if you want to abstain then do it.

I personally have found that when I have sex on a regular basis I feel much better and I am able to concentrate better. I would say that having sex is a good thing and should not be abstained from. Have sex when you feel you are ready.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 25, 2009, 04:16:48 pm[/size][hr]Sexual abstinence is harmless, but a study by the British Medical Journal in 1997 over a 10 year period showed that having sex improved sense of smell, reduced risk of heart disease, improved weight loss, improved overall fitness, reduced depression, pain-relief, Less-frequent contraction of colds and flu, better bladder control, and better teeth. Within having sex there are many benefits, but if you want to abstain then do it.

I personally have found that when I have sex on a regular basis I feel much better and I am able to concentrate better. I would say that having sex is a good thing and should not be abstained from. Have sex when you feel you are ready.[/quote]I think we got it the first time, but thanks for clarifying.

item.title: Premarital Sex
item.dc:creator: @grantbm grantbm
item.description:
@grantbm wrote:

Sexual abstinence is harmless, but a study by the British Medical Journal in 1997 over a 10 year period showed that having sex improved sense of smell, reduced risk of heart disease, improved weight loss, improved overall fitness, reduced depression, pain-relief, Less-frequent contraction of colds and flu, better bladder control, and better teeth. Within having sex there are many benefits, but if you want to abstain then do it.

I personally have found that when I have sex on a regular basis I feel much better and I am able to concentrate better. I would say that having sex is a good thing and should not be abstained from. Have sex when you feel you are ready.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 25, 2009, 04:16:48 pm[/size][hr]Sexual abstinence is harmless, but a study by the British Medical Journal in 1997 over a 10 year period showed that having sex improved sense of smell, reduced risk of heart disease, improved weight loss, improved overall fitness, reduced depression, pain-relief, Less-frequent contraction of colds and flu, better bladder control, and better teeth. Within having sex there are many benefits, but if you want to abstain then do it.

I personally have found that when I have sex on a regular basis I feel much better and I am able to concentrate better. I would say that having sex is a good thing and should not be abstained from. Have sex when you feel you are ready.

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“jensie, post:68, topic:278300”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=367295.msg2837065#msg2837065 date=1245733937]

Then why do all the people that the pope visits talk to him like he is superior to them?
[/quote]Because Catholics are hypocrites.

That’s a bad generalisation, as most generalisations are. Maybe it’s because all people that go by ‘the bank’ generalise too much. I don’t think I’m a hypocrite.

Well, since the Bible is one big generalisation, I don’t think you have a point. Why would ALL people HAVE to wait to have sex until marriage? If that isn’t a generalisation…

You obviously don’t know what a generalisation is.

What I was saying is that the church orders us not to have sex before marriage as if we can’t decide that for ourselves. They want(ed) to keep their followers under complete control. I don’t understand why people still believe…[/quote]

It’s not about orders and control. It’s about what is right. No one orders you to do anything, and you have free choice to do whatever you want and won’t be punished or anything else if you don’t follow the churches teaching. People believe what they think is right and want to believe and it is not yours or anyone else’s place to tell them they are wrong.
